Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: cmake
Description: Command-line interface of the cross-platform buildsystem generator CMake

Arguments.Name: S
Arguments.Description: Path to root directory of the CMake project to build

Arguments.Name: B
Arguments.Description: Path to directory which CMake will use as the root of build directory. If the directory doesn't already exist CMake will make it

Arguments.Name: C
Arguments.Description: Pre-load a script to populate the cache

Arguments.Name: D
Arguments.Description: Create or update a CMake CACHE entry

Arguments.Name: U
Arguments.Description: Remove matching entries from CMake CACHE

Arguments.Name: T
Arguments.Description: Toolset specification for the generator, if supported

Arguments.Name: A
Arguments.Description: Specify platform name if supported by generator

Arguments.Name: toolchain
Arguments.Description: Specify the cross compiling toolchain file, equivalent to setting CMAKE_TOOLCHAIN_FILE variable

Arguments.Name: --install-prefix
Arguments.Description: Specify the installation directory, used by the CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX variable. Must be an absolute path

Arguments.Name: deprecated
Arguments.Description: Make deprecated macro and function warnings errors

Arguments.Name: deprecated
Arguments.Description: Make deprecated macro and function warnings not errors

Arguments.Name: --log-context
Arguments.Description: Enable the message() command outputting context attached to each message

Arguments.Name: --debug-trycompile
Arguments.Description: Do not delete the try_compile() build tree

Arguments.Name: --debug-output
Arguments.Description: Put cmake in a debug mode

Arguments.Name: --debug-find
Arguments.Description: Put cmake find commands in a debug mode

Arguments.Name: --trace-expand
Arguments.Description: Put cmake in trace mode with variables expanded

Arguments.Name: --trace-format
Arguments.Description: Put cmake in trace mode and sets the trace output format

Arguments.Name: --trace-source
Arguments.Description: Put cmake in trace mode, but output only lines of a specified file

Arguments.Name: --trace-redirect
Arguments.Description: Put cmake in trace mode and redirect trace output to a file instead of stderr

Arguments.Name: --warn-unused-vars
Arguments.Description: Does nothing. In CMake versions 3.2 and below this enabled warnings about unused variables. In CMake versions 3.3 through 3.18 the option was broken. In CMake 3.19 and above the option has been removed

Arguments.Name: --no-warn-unused-cli
Arguments.Description: Don't warn about command line options. Don't find variables that are declared on the command line, but not used

Arguments.Name: --check-system-vars
Arguments.Description: Find problems with variable usage in system files

Arguments.Name: --preset
Arguments.Description: Reads a preset from <path-to-source>/CMakePresets.json and <path-to-source>/CMakeUserPresets.json. The preset may specify the generator and the build directory, and a list of variables and other arguments to pass to CMake. The current working directory must contain CMake preset files. The CMake GUI can also recognize CMakePresets.json and CMakeUserPresets.json files

Arguments.Name: --build
Arguments.Description: Project binary directory to be built and must be first. This is required unless a preset is specified

Arguments.Name: --preset
Arguments.Description: Use a build preset to specify build options

Arguments.Name: --list-presets
Arguments.Description: Lists the available presets. If no option is specified only configure presets will be listed. The current working directory must contain CMake preset files

Arguments.Name: --parallel
Arguments.Description: The maximum number of concurrent processes to use when building. If <jobs> is omitted the native build tool's default number is used

Arguments.Name: --target
Arguments.Description: Build <tgt> instead of the default target. Multiple targets may be given, separated by spaces

Arguments.Name: --clean-first
Arguments.Description: Build target clean first, then build

Arguments.Name: --use-stderr
Arguments.Description: Ignored. Behavior is default in CMake >= 3.0

Arguments.Name: --verbose
Arguments.Description: Enable verbose output - if supported - including the build commands to be executed
Pass remaining options to the native tool

Arguments.Name: --install
Arguments.Description: Project binary directory to install. This is required and must be first

Arguments.Name: --component
Arguments.Description: Component-based install. Only install component specified

Arguments.Name: --open
Arguments.Description: Open the generated project in the associated application. This is only supported by some generators

Arguments.Name: -P
Arguments.Description: Process the given cmake file as a script written in the CMake language. No configure or generate step is performed and the cache is not modified. If variables are defined using -D, this must be done before the -P argument

Arguments.Name: -E
Arguments.Description: CMake provides builtin command-line tools through the signature

Arguments.Name: capabilities
Arguments.Description: Report cmake capabilities in JSON format. The output is a JSON object with the following keys

Arguments.Name: cat
Arguments.Description: Concatenate files and print on the standard output

Arguments.Name: chdir
Arguments.Description: Change the current working directory and run a command

Arguments.Name: compare_files
Arguments.Description: Check if file1 is the same as file2. If fails are the same, then returns 0, if not returns 1. In case of invalid arguments, it returns 2

Arguments.Name: --ignore-eol
Arguments.Description: Implies line-wise comparison and ignores LF/CRLF differences

Arguments.Name: copy
Arguments.Description: Copy files to <destination> (either file or directory). If multiple files are specified, the <destination> must be directory and it must exist. Wildcards are not supported. copy does follow symlinks. That means it does not copy symlinks, but the files or directories it point to

Arguments.Name: copy_directory
Arguments.Description: Copy content of <dir>... directories to <destination> directory. If <destination> directory does not exist it will be created. copy_directory does follow symlinks

Arguments.Name: copy_if_different
Arguments.Description: Copy files to <destination> (either file or directory) if they have changed. If multiple files are specified, the <destination> must be directory and it must exist. copy_if_different does follow symlinks

Arguments.Name: echo_append
Arguments.Description: Displays arguments as text but no new line

Arguments.Name: env
Arguments.Description: Run command in a modified environment

Arguments.Name: false
Arguments.Description: Do nothing, with an exit code of 1

Arguments.Name: make_directory
Arguments.Description: Create <dir> directories. If necessary, create parent directories too. If a directory already exists it will be silently ignored

Arguments.Name: md5sum
Arguments.Description: Create MD5 checksum of files in md5sum compatible format

Arguments.Name: sha1sum
Arguments.Description: Create SHA1 checksum of files in sha1sum compatible format

Arguments.Name: sha224sum
Arguments.Description: Create SHA224 checksum of files in sha224sum compatible format

Arguments.Name: sha226sum
Arguments.Description: Create SHA226 checksum of files in sha226sum compatible format

Arguments.Name: sha384sum
Arguments.Description: Create SHA384 checksum of files in sha384sum compatible format

Arguments.Name: sha512sum
Arguments.Description: Create SHA512 checksum of files in sha512sum compatible format

Arguments.Name: remove
Arguments.Description: Remove the file(s). The planned behavior was that if any of the listed files already do not exist, the command returns a non-zero exit code, but no message is logged

Arguments.Name: f
Arguments.Description: The -f option changes the behavior to return a zero exit code (i.e. success) in such situations instead. remove does not follow symlinks. That means it remove only symlinks and not files it point to

Arguments.Name: remove_directory
Arguments.Description: Remove <dir> directories and their contents. If a directory does not exist it will be silently ignored. If <dir> is a symlink to a directory, just the symlink will be removed. Use rm instead

Arguments.Name: rm
Arguments.Description: Remove the files <file> or directories dir

Arguments.Name: r
Arguments.Description: Use -r or -R to remove directories and their contents recursively. If any of the listed files/directories do not exist, the command returns a non-zero exit code, but no message is logged

Arguments.Name: f
Arguments.Description: The -f option changes the behavior to return a zero exit code (i.e. success) in such situations instead

Arguments.Name: sleep
Arguments.Description: Sleep for given number of seconds

Arguments.Name: tar
Arguments.Description: Create or extract a tar or zip archive

Arguments.Name: c
Arguments.Description: Create a new archive containing the specified files. If used, the pathname argument is mandatory

Arguments.Name: x
Arguments.Description: Extract to disk from the archive. The <pathname>... argument could be used to extract only selected files or directories. When extracting selected files or directories, you must provide their exact names including the path, as printed by list (-t)

Arguments.Name: t
Arguments.Description: List archive contents. The <pathname>... argument could be used to list only selected files or directories

Arguments.Name: z
Arguments.Description: Compress the resulting archive with gzip

Arguments.Name: j
Arguments.Description: Compress the resulting archive with bzip2

Arguments.Name: J
Arguments.Description: Compress the resulting archive with XZ

Arguments.Name: --zstd
Arguments.Description: Compress the resulting archive with Zstandard

Arguments.Name: --files-from
Arguments.Description: Read file names from the given file, one per line. Blank lines are ignored. Lines may not start in - except for --add-file=<name> to add files whose names start in -

Arguments.Name: --format
Arguments.Description: Specify the format of the archive to be created

Arguments.Name: --mtime
Arguments.Description: Specify modification time recorded in tarball entries
Stop interpreting options and treat all remaining arguments as file names, even if they start with -

Arguments.Name: time
Arguments.Description: Run command and display elapsed time

Arguments.Name: touch
Arguments.Description: Creates <file> if file do not exist. If <file> exists, it is changing <file> access and modification times

Arguments.Name: touch_nocreate
Arguments.Description: Touch a file if it exists but do not create it. If a file does not exist it will be silently ignored

Arguments.Name: true
Arguments.Description: Do nothing, with an exit code of 0
